title: Job creation by U.S. president from Eisenhower to Obama
yAxis: Monthly average change in private sector jobs in thousand
summary: This is a bar chart representing American Presidents in the x axis and Monthly average change in private sector jobs in thousand in the y axis.
The Monthly average change in private sector jobs in thousand is highest at American Presidents Bill Clinton and lowest at American Presidents George W. Bush.
The difference of Monthly average change in private sector jobs in thousand between the highest and lowest American Presidents is 208.0.
min_summary: This bar chart has 9 columns on the x axis representing American Presidents, and Monthly average change in private sector jobs in thousand in each American Presidents on the y axis.
The Monthly average change in private sector jobs in thousand is highest at American Presidents Bill Clinton and lowest at American Presidents George W. Bush.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing American Presidents in the x axis and Monthly average change in private sector jobs in thousand in the y axis.
The Monthly average change in private sector jobs in thousand is highest at American Presidents Bill Clinton and lowest at American Presidents George W. Bush.
The difference of Monthly average change in private sector jobs in thousand between the highest and lowest American Presidents is 208.0.
max_summary: This bar chart has 9 columns on the x axis representing American Presidents, and Monthly average change in private sector jobs in thousand in each American Presidents on the y axis.
The Monthly average change in private sector jobs in thousand is appeared to be the highest at American Presidents Bill Clinton and lowest at American Presidents George W. Bush.
The second highest Monthly average change in private sector jobs in thousand is appeared to be the American Presidents Jimmy Carter.
The difference of Monthly average change in private sector jobs in thousand between the highest and lowest American Presidents is 208.0.

The American Presidents Bill Clinton has the highest Monthly average change in private sector jobs in thousand, followed by Jimmy Carter, and Ronald Reagan. Down to the American Presidents George W. Bush which is the lowest.
The average Monthly average change in private sector jobs in thousand in all 9 American Presidentss is 98.56.
Summing up the values of all American Presidentss, we get total 887.0.
